1.title: A Prelude to Behold
1.plot: As the play begins it's final rehearsals, Violet runs late, is under pressure from her mother, her boyfriend, but worse still, the show's director. Her only solace is a supportive co-star. Storms brew on the set, this is truly a prelude to behold.

2.title: A Performance to Behold
2.plot: After the tension of the preproduction, the play finally takes to the stage. Aubin, full of his own importance just can't help himself and performs in the play he has written and is directing, much to the chagrin of Violet and especially James. As the play continues on, Violet begins to see the parallels between herself and the character she is portraying . It begins to dawn on her that she too, like the character she is portraying, must make some critical life decisions and take a stand, otherwise, despite a clingy boyfriend who has left her to her own devices and a ...

3.title: A Wrap to Behold
3.plot: As the play reaches it's conclusion Violet begins to find the confidence to take control of her own destiny. But will she find the right words to not only help James understand her point of view, have Aubin finally respect her as an actor and win over her captive audience as they head towards a wrap to behold?

imdb.plot outline: Violet,a a young actress has landed a potentially career changing lead role in a play, but she has a few obstacles to overcome. Her own insecurities, a clingy relationship with Richard, a man that really doesn't believe in her ..... and not to mention the productions own nightmare, the show's producer/director Aubin. Her solace is one of her co-stars, James, but can Violet accept his encouragements while deflecting the insane rantings from Aubin, a boyfriend glaring from he wings and the pressure of being a lead?
imdb.title: An Audience to Behold
plot: Violet, a young actor who just landed a potentially career changing lead role in a play, however, unless she can overcome her own insecurities and break away from the negative relationships in her life, she will never succeed.
